intro: Corispermum papillosum, commonly known as the hairy corisperm, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is characterized by its small, green, fleshy leaves and clusters of tiny, yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in saline or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its seeds are encased in a thin, papery shell, which aids in wind dispersal. Corispermum papillosum is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil in degraded areas.
